content.label:
You pay for the adventures, you pay for the characters then you will roll ones until you fork out yet more money for runes to make the game easier. 

Just buy the physical game it is much better and you can play it alone or with friends.

title.label: Very Good, But Not For Everybody

content.label:
If you want a deep, complicated dungeon crawler with lots of little fiddly things to fuss over, Pathfinder Adventures is top-notch. But casual gamers will bounce off it like a non-magic sword off a lich.

Note: development is basically entirely over. I’d be shocked to see another patch released. Been four years since the last one. Game works fine and is still tons of fun, but don’t hope for more content.

The app is fine solo, but the card game is really best when played cooperatively by a group. How is there no way to play with friends online?!? The app is ok, but to match the greatness of the physical game it needs multiplayer. If it had that, it would be better than the original!

I downloaded this game and played through the tutorial. It was neat and fun. A couple of issues with the messages not being able to be dismissed, but I can work around that. What I can’t work around is the bad rolls every game. When I throw a d12 and 3 d6s at a challenge and roll 2s and 3 every time I need to pass something crucial to progress and then bottom out against enemies? It just feels like the game has an unfair advantage against the player. Along with the micro transactions, it feels more like a pay to win game. I had fun for the first hour but the constant “You’ll roll low every time “ thing is highly irritating to the point I don’t want to play and it definitely doesn’t get me in the mood to drop money on it.

title.label: Overall a great game but gamebreaking bugs persist through major revisions,

content.label: and not only persisted, but caused me to have to start over. Ugh.

I wanted to like this, because I love Pathfinder and the Iconics. The basic gameplay flow as shown in the tutorial is pretty good, but this game masquerades as FTP when it’s really just a demo.

As soon as you finish the tutorial, you’re taken to start a Rise of the Runelords campaign, where it recommends you form a party of 3-4 characters. Problem is, you only have TWO you can pick from. It also tells you you can make your own, but as far as I can tell it’s just you renaming an existing character.

To get more characters you have to pay real money, or I suppose grind like crazy to try and unlock one of the goblin versions of them... which I’m not sure would actually unlock the character or not tbh.

title.label: Was a great game until support disappeared.

content.label:
As many others have noted, the game simply no longer works. Regardless of what actions I take, within 10-30 seconds of clicking anything on the menu screen the game crashes. Normally I would just delete and forget, but I used this as an alternative to picking up the physical game and have made more than my share of in game purchases.

This issue has persisted for over a year now over two different iPhone models and an iPad. This is rather disheartening and  caused me to make the decision to no longer support anything from the developers/publishers no matter how appealing. I’ll update the review if anything ever gets fixed, but I doubt it will.

Downloaded this game not expecting too much. Boy was I wrong! The graphics are superb and content is fresh and new each battle. It’s true that the tutorial is a bit long, but it is needed to get the most out of the game. I love that you can be in the middle of a battle, and you suddenly need to close the game for some unexpected reason and when you reopen, you are exactly where you left off!.  You can play for one minute or 5+ hours (like I have before), and it’s a new challenge every time. 
   The game does give you small amounts of gold for closing each small area, and new cards to use or sell for 1 gold each. It is a bit of a grinch game but that is what I like. I have spent some money on gold and a few chests. Guaranteed high level items in 1 of 4. Get this game if you want something to do to fill the gaps in your bus ride, waiting at the Dr. Office or just chilling in bed before sleeping. Just a fun game!

title.label: I love the physical card game. But I can’t figure out how to purchase additional characters etc.

content.label: I love the physical card game and playing through the tutorials this app is a good recreation. I gave two stars because something is broken. I cannot figure out how to purchase character add on packs.  The store button on the collections section doesn’t do anything. So I can’t pay or play ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
I love this and wish they would make more

title.label: Here comes the flood game breaker

content.label: This is a great implementation of the physical card game. Alas everything was working until the final location of the game. Critical to slaying the last boss is the ability to reveal and order the cards in the location deck. When I use revelation magic like the item “revelation quill” the game ask me to bury the card and confirm the action. After doing so the game just glitches. Is veryyyyyyy frustrating after many hours of play. I have read that this happens to many people. So for me is a full con.

title.label: Nicely designed app but no idea how to play!

content.label: The app looks nice and seems to work well, but learning how to play this game is like trying to fly a 747 jet airplane. The tutorial isn’t doing much for me. Afraid you really need another person who knows how to play to learn the ropes :/

title.label: Great game - a bit of a grind... but in a good way

content.label:
A great game... it will be annoying at times due to failing high percentage chance dice rolls... but remember, it’s a dice chucking game, and if you roll 100 times, a 90% chance should fail 10 of those times. Once you get into the groove of the game, you know when to expend that extra blessing to increase the chance and when to accept a guaranteed failure.

I went ahead and purchased Rise of the Runelords since I was having fun and felt a good game deserved the purchase, and feel it was worth it. I have had many hours of enjoyment playing different parties of characters, going back and rerunning the earlier scenarios so I can improve all the characters I like. And each character plays differently based on their powers and card options. Also, unlocking roles (after completing deck 3 with a character) opens up more options to customize.
Just like the card game. While I enjoy it, aspects don’t make sense like mages using heavy armor and two handed weapons but overall it’s very enjoyable and complex but in a good way.

Latest update seems to have weighted the dice.  

Not worth playing.  Lost a 100% chance to win role.  Three times.
Game is great, but it doesn’t fit on modern devices very well (iPhone 11 Pro Max for example).

title.label: Awesome game big progress save issues

content.label: I like the game but, I have to reconnect my account every time I play and I have lost at least 4 completed scenarios in just a few days. It seems to randomly revert back to old save points with no rhyme or reason.

title.label: Feels like a tabletop game however

content.label:
I really wish it offered a networking multiplayer function, I hate pass and play even if it was just a local LAN type multiplayer, despite the covid issue at the moment a full networking multiplayer would be nice.

Also just noticed the game hasn’t been updated in 2 years? Anyway if the game had networking multiplayer, my brother, and tabletop friends would most likely be willing to dump money into this due to our innability to play together. Not everyone has a computer so TTS is out of the questions.

title.label: Bought full version, it’s gone now

content.label:
Downloaded full version, played full campaign, removed app, can’t get it back.
Won’t let me buy it again either. Fun when I can play

title.label: Plays just like the card game

content.label:
I see a lot of reviews on here that are complaining about a pay wall and it’s unfair to rate a great game with low stars based on that factor alone.  Most games on IOS are pay to play these days.  It’s just a fact of life now so instead of complaining about the fact you have to pay to unlock additional scenarios let’s focus on how many positive notes this game hits.  (I’d also like to mention that the actual tabletop Pathfinder Adventure Card Game requires you to pay for each additional scenario as an expansion so this is no different other than you get to play the first three missions for FREE in this version)
So here are the pros:
-Plays exactly like the tabletop version
-great graphics and cards are detailed 
-actually adds more storyline with cut scenes making it feel more like an adventure and less random 
-you don’t have to remember all of the rules associated with each card which makes things much easier 
-feels like an actual campaign 
-Game mechanics work well 
Cons:
-it’s a little clunky if you haven’t played the table top version so may take some time to understand the nuances and game mechanics 
In closing I would like to see some of the expansions developed in the iOS version as this is a great adaptation of the tabletop version
Draw cards to defeat enemies or find magical items. Roll dice to defeat or acquire. Very fun. The base is free and includes a few scenarios. Additional scenarios can be purchased.
Great game if you have the money to invest in it. Most of the premium characters and storylines are behind a very steep paywall (for a mobile game).

This game is a total pay to win game. They make the starting of the game very difficult which will make you pay for different packages or cards just to get through it. If this game was more free to play friendly, it would be much more successful. Until then I do not recommend playing this game.

I love this game! The adaptation from physical game to app is very good. It is nice that they provide a way to earn scenarios without money but truly the best way to experience the game is to buy the scenarios to begin with. If I have a complaint it is: why haven’t the developers added the scenarios from skulls and shackles and the mummy mask wrath of the righteous. I’d like to own them all (again) through this app. Keep up the good work.

I have played and replayed this app multiple times because I love playing it so much. I also have some of the physical Pathfinder Adventure Card Game sets. What I really want is for the other base sets to be added, such as Skull and Shackles.

title.label: Spend 15$ on the pack it’s worth it

content.label:
If you play’s the first couple quests and like it, get the 15$ pack, you get more then enough heroes to form a party up to 6 and all the adventures from the first game (referencing the physical card game).

A party of 6 really adds to the strategy, customization, and fun!

His game is underrated. It was buggy when it first came out, but now it is a well polished game. Obviously to play the game you will have to spend some money but the board game it is based on is more expensive. I’m looking forward to more expansions for this game.

Great game but needs to have the ability to permanently discard cards in the deck menu. I have so many cards (10 more cards then the max cards per character and max storage) with just a two character party that I can’t even play/progress the game anymore. Because I cannot Exit out of the deck menu due to the card deck over flow and character deck over flow.

I love the game, and unlike many complainants I have no issue with developers actually charging for their products. (Spend money? The horror!) However, as nearly as I can tell the game has been abandoned by the developer...no new content seems to have been generated in over a year. Too bad, I would have gladly paid more money for additional content. Definitely worth the investment to play through what is there, however.
The game is very easy to learn and if very fun it’s just too bad that you have to pay to get any further then zone one
Don’t bother even trying to play this on a phone. Should have only been released on tablets. Everything is much too small for a phone interface. Totally ridiculous!

If there has ever been a game that doesn't seem like it wants you to play it - it's this one. The tutorial is so long and tedious it makes you feel you've literally aged a yest just going through it. If your game is so complicated it needs an hour worth of tutorial then maybe start looking at what's wrong with it. I finally got into the game and guess what - more gddamn tutorial notes.   Screw this game, I'm out.

The game at it's core is great. Fun and high quality. But the content doesn't go super far before getting repetitive, and the devs seem to have abandoned the game, with no communication or plan for updates.

If properly supported, I'd give 5 *'s, no hesitation.

title.label: Problematic-no way to return to correct errors in set up

content.label: I could not complete the tutorial with three places merely because I did not set a warrior to the site or some other glitch. Could not move forward and could not move backward to correct the situation. And this was at tutorial level

title.label: Great mobile version of the great card game

content.label:
Yes, you have to pay for it, but if you buy the whole adventure path youre getting 30 adventures and endless party configurations for replayability.  This isn’t a free-to-play mobile game but you get what you pay for. 

It adds an ok story element and great music both missing from the physical card game that originally cost 4x the price of the full bundle for the app.

title.label: Complex and interesting strategy game with a story

content.label:
I am loving this game. I had Pathfinder card game at home but it wasn’t as much fun when we had to spend so much time on figuring out the rules. I love that this takes out the work and lets me have fun.  I really enjoy the strategy of the card deck building and the choice of characters/location.  It usually takes me a few tries to win a scenario, to get to know it and plan for it.  I love the challenge. It is one of the few iPad games that I enjoy the playing of itself, rather than the enjoyment of “winning” or “gacha” aspects where you are collecting heroes or whatnot.  In this game, I really enjoy the whole experience.  I purchased the entire set of adventures, which is well worth it for the price, especially if you enjoy the introduction.

The story/dialogue is brief but funny and enjoyable too.  I am getting attached to my heroes!  It did take me some time to really understand all the rules but that’s part of the fun.

I just started playing dnd and it’s confusing but I have a good teacher (DM) to show me the ropes. Maybe I’m an idiot or lack the attention to pay attention but this game is very very confusing; before, during, and after the tutorial. I feel like I’m just throwing cards here and there and everywhere. I play card A: I die. Okaaay so I play card B: I die. Alright.....card C has to be it: Nope dead. I suppose I could spend a whole weekend just sitting there reading every card to figure it all out but that won’t fix the fact that burying a card (the chain thing in the top left too) and discarding and this and that and this and what not, it’s just super confusing and I didn’t care much for the very long tutorial that got me nowhere.

I’ll catch a ton of flak from the diehards that eat sleep and breathe this game but that’s okay.

I’ll always have dnd and a DM in person to show me what the heckin’ I’m looking at and what I’m supposed to do and why.
Fast and responsive to technical assistance great game brings the actual card game to life with a great story board!!
Would give it 5 stars but the game doesn’t fit full screen on iPhone XS. Update please

title.label: Made me want to but the tabletop version

content.label: Awesome game, took some getting use to but now that I got the hang of it I can't stop playing it. I am looking frantically to buy the table top version now to playwith others. I would love if they added expantions.

I've never played the Pathfinder system and found it to be interesting. I'm sure that if you've played it before, the game mechanics would be easy to follow. I found that I still felt a bit unsure after going through the tutorial. After the tutorial, there's a bit of a pay-to-play. I'd rather put my money into something I know I'll enjoy. Uninstalling.

I picked this game up thinking that it looked interesting and would give it a go. I ended up playing it a lot.  It has a bit of a random element but the character progression and deck building is a lot of fun.

I would highly recommend.

title.label: Easy to die. Pay to play

content.label: The game is really neat, but you have to pay to open the world up. I live PF but this game left a bad taste in my mouth. Love the music and feel. And it’s really easy to die after you’ve spent 20 minutes finding the boss. I do not have much patience for games based on random rolls and encounters, but disguise themselves as games of skill.

Game seems fun from the small amount I have been able to play without spending money. Problem is that the entire game is locked behind an increasing paywall. The total cost of everything is probably close to 100$ and there is no way to get the stuff for free. The funniest thing is that there is a gold currency in the game that you can also buy with real money but it unlocks nothing new. Another potentially good mobile game ruined by greed.

“Oh great...ANOTHER ‘card’ game!”

.....BUT: it’s really well made, and just plain fun. 
Very pleasantly surprised!
Definitely worth a download and maybe throwing them some $ down the line.

This game has loads of potential, but is only pay to play past the tutorial and first mission. Literally everything costs real money to unlock...additional characters (past the first 2), missions, etc. etc.

 Very, VERY disappointing from a pen-and-paper rpg company that is open source for all of their pen-and-paper content and whose developers and authors allegedly left Wizards of the Coast due to their constant rebooting in pursuit of gold pieces. This is an especially awful example as everything has a cost. Nickel and dimes forever

This game has loads of potential and could have an easy fix by initiating a daily energy allotment for free-to-play players. As a general rule I ABSOLUTELY will not spend money on games that have no possible ftp option. It’s my way of returning the foul solo digit offered by pay-to-play/win only games.
Win will you come out with the rest of the games¿

title.label: It’s great unless you enjoy being able to see on your phone

content.label: It’s fun, but ALL the text is entirely too small if you’re on your phone. I always have to guess or reallyyyyy squint to read the info on the cards

While I did like the combination of card based items and the d&d elements mixed together, after playing chapter 1-2 the fun was already turning into boredom. The game is heavily pushing for micro transactions, not that it gives you pop up ads every few minutes or anything (thank you for not doing that).
 In order to get any new character you need to pay them, mind you the pay wall is not that high with a $1-$15 dollar range (rounded up by on cent) but nickel and diming your player base is not the right way to go at all regardless if you are trying to make revenue.
Overall I liked the d&d dice rolling and card based equipment, however the heavy micro transactions is a huge deterrent in order to “unlock” characters which are actually behind a pay wall and don’t seems to come alive in the story.

It’s a rly cool game but not enough to do in the free section, plus if I wanted to buy more I can’t even find the store to make any purchases.
I’d rly enjoy playing more even if I have to buy it to bad I can’t find the stupid store to do such
